fields.description:
SourceTree 2.1.7 beta works just fine when launched directly from the folder: app-2.1.7-beta-0\SourceTree.exe

SourceTree 2.1.8 beta fails to load, throwing an error:

"We were not able to locate a Git install on your system already.  There are 3 ways we can deal with this:"

I am not using the embedded git.  Since seeing this error I just updated to the latest Git for Windows 2.13.3-64-bit.  The same thing happened with 2.13.2-64-bit.

 

I'll revert to 2.1.7 until this is fixed.

 

Edit:

This has been resolved as of SourceTree 2.2.1.0 beta.
fields.summary: Git not found in SourceTree beta 2.1.8

fields.description:
Hi, first of, we love SourceTree! We're a small team of six and it's become a can't function without tool. Thank you for all your hard work.

We really like seeing the git commands and responses during push/pull/commit etc (via 'Always display full console output'). Although some git operations we care less about and are not always interested in the console output. The idea is instead of interacting with the modal dialog for each command, it would be favorable to have an accompanying tabbed window 'Console' like File Status, Log / History and Search.  This tab would just show a rolling history of the git commands and the corresponding output output just as you would have from the command line. Perhaps a clear button too. In special cases, for example a merge conflict perhaps a dialog appears then (if possible). The modal dialog works but it's an extra click every time to Close. Most of us only wish to see output ~1/3 the time but it would more clicks to change the UI setting each time to view the git console output. 

Hope that makes sense and thanks for your consideration. 

Cheers!
fields.summary: Make git console as optional tab instead of modal dialog

fields.description:
Problem 
   When clicking one of mentioned buttons user sees standard windows button over the designed one (see screenshot). After that one can not use that button again.

Should be
   No overlapped buttons, buttons should always work as expected.
fields.summary: Weird behavior of minimize, expand and close buttons
testing

fields.description: I can't seem to resize the window from the top edge, only bottom and left/right, normal windows allow me to resize in any direction... this becomes a real problem when i need to resize the window on a smaller screen as i can't move the window high enough to reach the bottom of the window...
fields.summary: Can't resize window from the top

fields.description: I can't move the window from one screen to another when maximized like i can with all other windows...

fields.description: What happens is the window appears to be outside of the screen as when i mouse over on the taskbar i can see the window beeing transparent, but i can't move it using the standard Win + Arrowkeys
fields.summary: Messageboxes appear offscreen when dual monitor and moving sourcetree

fields.description:
Sometimes the window "Restored Down" but the height is too big (this happens when I remote my PC while source tree is opened), I can't in anyway reduce the height, most if not all of the programs used to get resized from top border, but in SourceTree I can't, so I'm stuck now on always maximized window because I can't simply resize the window!

Very annoying, and make no sense at all.
fields.summary: There is no way to fix window height if it was too big

fields.description:
# Have conflicts
 # Right Click > Resolve Conflicts > Launch External Merge Tool
 # Kdiff3 launches
 ## Creates 4 "extra" files
 ### _BACKUP
 ### _BASE
 ### _LOCAL
 ### _REMOTE
 # Resolve conflicts
 # Save in Kdiff3
 # Close Kdiff3
 # "Extra" files are gone
 # File still shows as "Conflicted" and my changes that were made in Kdiff3 are no longer there

 

Not really sure what is going on, it's like SourceTree and KDiff3 aren't communicating correctly, or maybe KDiff3 isn't saving the file in the correct location? 

Any thoughts or direction would be great
fields.summary: External Merge Tool Not Saving Changes

I use Windows type crlf.

fields.summary: Directory in gitignore_global.txt is not working

fields.description:
SourceTree for Windows is affected by vulnerabilities found in the Git and Mercurial software. This vulnerability can be triggered through a malicious repository when it is checked out using SourceTree. From version 0.8.4b of SourceTree for Windows this vulnerability can be triggered from a webpage through the use of the SourceTree URI handler.


*Affected versions:*
* Versions of SourceTree for Windows starting with 0.5.1.0 before version 2.1.10 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
* Upgrade SourceTree for Windows to version 2.1.10 or higher from https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/

 
For additional details see [the full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/c-mdNw].
fields.summary: Remote Code Execution via Git and Mercurial - (CVE-2017-1000117, CVE-2017-1000115, CVE-2017-1000116)

fields.description:
Trying to run the SourceTree application on Windows fails. "SourceTree has stopped working."
 * Reinstalling does not resolve the problem.
 * Following the steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-crashes-on-startup-831655339.html] does not resolve the problem (user.config file is not corrupted)
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on launch since version 2.1.2.5

fields.description:
Looking at the change preview panels (either when staging a file in _File Status_, or selecting it from a commit in _Log / History_) there is no quick way to see what the previous name/path of the selected file was.

 

By default you only get the rather unhelpful default note: "No changes in this file have been detected, or it is a binary file":

!https://i.imgur.com/6RAKOwz.png!

Specifically when staging files, there seems to be no way to see what the previous path of the file was using SourceTree's UI. _Blame_ and _Log_ are both blank when staging, and the 'more options' ellipses to the right only show the option to unstage the file.

 

Once committed, you can of course use the _Log_ with _Follow renamed files_ enabled to see the previous path:

!https://i.imgur.com/7vb3jUh.png!

But it would be really nice to be able to see this information at a glance, especially when staging.

 

Please consider adding a single line to the preview that shows the previous filename/path.

Here is a quick Mockup of what this could look like in the staging UI:

!https://i.imgur.com/vgrceJa.png!

_^(Left margin of the 'no changes/binary' message deliberately left misaligned)^_

I believe the space cost of an extra line of text is more than made up for by the added clarity to the user of what is happening, and really the 'no changes/binary' message could be removed here (specifically for moved/renamed non-binary files), since it no longer conveys any useful information to the user in this case.
fields.summary: Renamed/Moved File Path Preview
SourceTree dialogs pop up out of reach of the mouse

fields.description:
Files with very long filenames (probably starting at the same length that also creates the "filename too long" error) get deleted when staged in SourceTree. Files have to be loaded from a backup to restore.

This happens every time.

Longpaths are enabled in the global git config as well as the project's git config.

If the files are staged via the windows command line, it works just fine.
fields.summary: Files with long names get deleted when staged

fields.description:
hi !

Before the last updates the tags in format "2017/07/17/name" appear as folders ("/") and now they look like normal list, can you see what happened?

thanks
fields.summary: Tag Display Problem

fields.description:
Right now the diff display highlights (with red /green) just the line differences.

It would be helpful to go one step further to have character differences within each highlighted line to be highlighted with a stronger red / green colour.

Much in the same way that Bitbucket displays the diff when in a Pull Request or Commit view.

I've attached a screenshot of a sample of Bitbucket's diff visual.
fields.summary: Update file diff display to highlight specific differences

fields.description:
I use Bitbucket to connect to Git and Mercurial repositories on Bitbucket and GitHub.

When I leave SourceTree open, once every five minutes it displays a "Bitbucket Login" dialog asking for my username and password for Bitbucket. *If I close the dialog without entering my username and password, the dialog immediately reappears. The only way to get the dialog to go away is to enter my username and password*, but even then, it will come back in 5 minutes.

This bug severely disrupts my work, since the Bitbucket Login dialog interrupts what I am doing every time it pops up. *SourceTree should not need me to log in once every 5 minutes. +The login dialog should never immediately reappear if I close it.+*
fields.summary: SourceTree asks for Bitbucket login every few minutes

fields.description: Currently, creating a pull request in SourceTree involves selecting menu option Repository->Create Pull Request or shift-alt-p. This opens Bitbucket in a web browser and then one can create a pull request there. I'd prefer not to have to open the web browser to create the pull request. Please add the full feature of pull requests to SourceTree. Thanks!
fields.summary: Add pull request feature to SourceTree

fields.description:
The icons to minimize, reduce or close the window have some UI problem, see the printscreen.

Is complicate to click the button.
fields.summary: UI interface broken

fields.description:
In Source Tree, when there is merge conflict, I launch the external diff tool P4Merge. In the P4Merge I resolved the conflict, click save and Exit in P4Merge. It is suppose that the conflict in the source tree disappear, however it is not. The conflict file still in the 'unstaged file" window. 

When I reboot the PC, the problem solved: The conflict disappear when exit P4Merge. This problem happens repeatedly, I need to reboot the PC when this issue occur.
fields.summary: P4Merge has problem as External diff tool in SourceTree
Does not recognize duplicate entries

fields.description:
# Create ssh key
 # Load it
 # Use it as normal (e.g. git clone) through the app
 # Delete it
 # Attempt to reuse it

Expected: Some kind of error message

Actual: Application hangs irrecoverably
fields.summary: Deleting a loaded SSH Key crashes app at next "read"

fields.description:
I have an intermittent problem when I try to use an external diff tool (namely KDiff 3 on Windows 10) with sourcetree.

In a usual merge scenario between branches, one file have a conflict. I start KDiff3 using the usual "Resolve Conflict -> Use external diff tool", the tools pops up, and then does it's magic.

Now, for simple modifications (one line) or complex ones (lots of lines), the result is the same. I review the modification, select which branches, and when I am satisfied with the modification, save the file, and then close the KDiff3 app.

Upon my return, Sourcetree has cleaned the compare files (I am refering to the "*_BACKUP_SALT*", "*_BASE_SALT*", "*_LOCAL_SALT*" and "*_REMOTE_SALT*" files that are generated during the call to the external diff app), as it should.

BUT, the original file with conflict remains, as if nothing happened. Which means all my work for conflict resolution has been lost.

When this happens, and because of this I know my handling of the external app is correct, I usually open the diff app, do THE EXACT SAME modification required (easy when only one line is conflicted), but instead of just closing the diff app, i refocus the sourcetree windows, return focus to the diff app, THEN close the diff app, and upon returning to the sourcetree app, all conflict files AND the conflicted file of the merge vanish from the "Unstaged files" windows.

Thing is, sometimes it happens, sometimes it does not, and my "fix" (if you can call it that) does not always prevent this behavior.

In light of this, is this a bug? If there a race condition where sourcetree blocks the correct handling of files by the external app, and then handles any error by just ignoring the modifications to the conflicted file? The is no error message whatsoever in either app, so it is quite difficult to see where things go bad.

Any help on this matter is welcome.

NOTE: I know sourcetree has issues when conflicts appears whenone of the file version is renamed or marked for deletion in the merge sequence: this is not this situation (which I handle by using the branches which deletes the files, usually). This is a standard content conflict on a single file.
fields.summary: External Merge Tool changes not reflected in SourceTree

fields.description:
We are not affected by any of the already mentioned issues with the sidebar and the Bitbucket Server authentication.
But the referesh of repositories is so slow that waiting for SourceTree to refresh is one of the biggest annoyances in 2.1.7.0
Even with just 4 repositories cloned from a local Bitbucket Server {color:#707070}v4.11.2 {color}open and a new initialized Git repository it took almost 1 minute to refresh the view.
An indicator is the always moving progress bar on the top left above "File Status"
fields.summary: Performance is slow

fields.description: One of my users got the 2.1.7.0 push, and after installing it the authentication fails when trying to push/pull from our Bitbucket Server. We tried refresh password but it still failed. Reinstalling 2.1.2.5 and everything works correctly. I'll log an issue for it, but just wanted to get it out there
fields.summary: Repeated GCM authentication prompts for Bitbucket Server

fields.description: Seems to be losing extended repository extended information again (this bug was reported in 2.x betas, fixed, and now back again).   Very annoying when your primary workflow uses JIRA/Stash branch checkout via web.
fields.summary: SourceTree is not loading the extended sourcetreeconfig information

fields.description:
Remote branches used to be listed alphabetical, but there now seems to be some random ordering that doesn't really make sense for us.    (see attached screenshot) 
This caused us some mass confusion earlier, we all believed branches weren't showing, but there were there, just not where we expected them to be... 


Colleagues of mine have the same problem (beta 2.1.6 and earlier), that the regular branches (master, developer, and all feature branches) changed order at random, so that it was
develop
master
feature/*
or
master
feature/*
develop
 
Show trimmed content
fields.summary: Branch is randomly changed

fields.description:
If you are operating offline, because you are e. g. travelling or have a VPN running with restricted internet access, then SourceTree is staring quite slowly, because it runs into a timeout.

Ultimately, once the timeout has been exceeded, this window will show:

  !2017-07-25 14_54_21-SourceTree.png!

This should be put into a task that is non-blocking to the opening of the UI.
fields.summary: Opening of SourceTree UI should not be blocked by this

fields.description:
When checking out a different branch, a wide progress dialog pops up showing checkout progress. Once this dialog closes the UI is still in a bit of flux, as evident by white history panes and such.

If the user now clicks the pull button in the toolbar, the dialog that pops up wants to pull into the branch you checked out, but wants to pull from the tracking branch of the previous branch.

If, instead of clicking the button at once when the dialog disappears, the user waits until the rest of the UI has stabilized before clicking pull, the dialog defaults to the right tracking branch.
fields.summary: Asynchronous UI at fault when switching branches, defaults pull to incorrect branch

fields.description:
Hi there,

 

I am new to Sourcetree and, if I may, would like to suggest a couple of small improvements regarding popup window:
 * If "everything is green", close the window automatically. I've found myself clicking on the "close" button too much. Or, don't close the window if mouse is hovering it.
 * Change the git commands output font to monospaced (Consolas, Courier new, etc.) - it will be much neater.

Thanks
fields.summary: Pop-up window improvements

fields.description:
There are a number of issues with the "Log Selected" & "Blame Selected" windows.
 * Most windows in Windows 10 can be repositioned when maximised by grabbing the title bar and dragging. No SourceTree windows (including the main SourceTree window) display this behaviour, although they do snap to the edges as other windows do. I often want to do this with the "Log" and "Blame" pop-up windows as I have two screens and I like to view the pop-ups on a different screen from the main SourceTree program
 * The "Log" and "Blame" windows start in a restored state, but full screen as if they are maximised. Clicking the restore/maximise button has no effect, not even changing the status of the button. It is necessary to minimise the window before it will start to behave as expected
 * The line numbers in "Blame" are left-justified and butt up against the edge of the window, making them hard to read. Some more space (even two pixels!) would help enormously! They should also be right-justified, i.e. {color:#ff0000}*999*{color} should align with 1{color:#ff0000}*000*{color}, not with {color:#ff0000}*100*{color}0
 * In the "Blame" window, sometimes when double-clicking on the separator between the headings "Line" and "Author", it opens the log window. This does not happen every time and I don't know the exact trigger for it. Since it does not remember the column widths each time, this is something I do frequently
fields.summary: "Log Selected" & "Blame Selected" windows behave strangely

fields.description: i have been trying for months to check in files your system keeps creating a lock file and never checks in any files.....
fields.summary: .git file lock file exist cannot check in any files

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Create a git repository with no "master" branch, a branch named "feature" and a branch names "release". Set the default branch to "release". I have attached an example repo.
 * Navigate to the Clone screen in SourceTree
 * Enter the path to the repository
 * Observe the value of the "Checkout branch" dropdown

Expected result: The value is "release"

Actual result: The value is "feature"

 

I have tested in 1.9.10.0 and the the "Checkout branch" is an empty text box. When cloned with this box left empty, it uses the correct default branch.
fields.summary: Clone does not select default branch when it isn't master
由于中国VPN被封禁，导致无法登陆初始化使用软件！！请求取消验证操作！！

fields.description: Consistently displays the `Uncommited changes` node at the top of the tree in the branches view even though there are no changes, I have even double check in git command line and tried clearing git cache.
fields.summary: Uncommited changes node

fields.description:
Enter key doesn't work on close button in the console output dialog. While seemingly harmless at first glance, if the user checks "Don't show me this message again" when the empty commit prompt displays, it's possible for the user to accidentally commit files prematurely when the enter key is pressed despite the overlay seemingly having the focus.

(Note that this was not a problem in legacy versions of SourceTree)

Steps to Reproduce:
 * Have "Always display full console output" option enabled in Source Tree's general options
 * Open any git repo in source tree in "Working Copy" view
 * Perform any change that causes the console dialog overlay to appear (e.g. unstage a file)
 * Console output overlay appears. Note 'Close' button has keyboard focus
 * Press 'Enter' once. (No action takes place)
 * Press 'Enter' a second time. Receive the following prompt "You left the commit message blank. Are you sure you want to commit...?"

Steps to Workaround
 * Click "Close" manually on any console dialog overlays
fields.summary: Pressing 'Enter' Key on Close Button Within Console Output Overlay's Doesn't Work

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a git repository.
# Add a text file and commit it.
# Modify the file content and commit the changes.
# Modify the file content once again and commit the changes.
# Rename the file and commit the changes.
# Rename the file once again and commit the changes.
# Log the file changes. => Log window shows.
# Check "Follow renamed files". => Log window shows all commits.
# Select the commit before the first renaming. => Right panel doesn't show any changes. And it's not possible to open external diff tool.

 !image-2017-07-24-12-56-06-435.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Log does not show diff for the files before they were renamed/moved twice

fields.description:
Thanks for great software, but for keyboard navigations fans it misses a couple of points that make life easier.
 # When SourceTree starts and shows Local repositories it would be great if focus would be on repository search input right away, so i can start and specify project name right away without clicking on that input manually
 # If i specify repository name in that text box and if it finds a repository with such name, then if i click Enter key, it can open that repository in new tab, so i also don't need to click it. As even if i use Tab that moves me to repositories list - Enter\Space key don't do anything there and i still need to use mouse to select it

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Keyboard navigation in repositories list\tabs

fields.description:
On the screen viewing all bookmarks, if there are many (20+ that fill the screen and then some) it is often desirable to remove some bookmarks.  When right-clicking on a bookmark, "Remove Bookmark" should be an option.  Further, "Delete" should not be an option anywhere in SourceTree.

(see screenshot 1)

I realize if you choose "Delete", then "Remove Bookmark", that removes the bookmark, but the problems with this are that first, it is not intuitive to choose "Delete" when you don't want to delete anything (just trying to remove the bookmark), and second and much more importantly, at that point you are only one miss-click away from deleting the entire repository on disk.

(see screenshot 2)

The disaster potential for this is huge, unnecessary, and not beneficial in any way.  If a developer would like to do something as dramatic as delete a repository on disk, they should have to exit SourceTree and browse files to manually delete the repository.

Other than this concern, I think SourceTree is great, but this concern alone is pushing me to use the Git features within Visual Studio rather than SourceTree since the disaster potential to loose days of work is so easily there with a single miss-click.  Please update this, thanks.
fields.summary: Suggest to remove "Delete" option, change to "Remove Bookmark"
Source Tree 2.1.7 Stub crashes at startup
fatal: TypeInitializationException encountered.

fields.description:
A minor issue with the diff view, is that sometimes for some unknown reason the font color changes to some very light gray which is hard to see. Notice the very first underscore appearing on line 3 - compared to the one in the line underneath it.

!Diff.png!
fields.summary: Inconsistent diff font coloring

fields.description:
h3. Summary

I have a large XML file stored in Git (GitHub) repo.

[user@host tools]$ ls -lh somefile.xml
 -rw-r--r-- 1 user users 1.6M Jul 19 17:25 somefile.xml
 [user@host tools]$ file somefile.xml
 somefile.xml: XML document, UTF-8 Unicode text, with very long lines

By default SourceTree for Windows is not showing diff for this file in any commit.

It shows a message "No changes in this file have been detected, or it is a binary file".

But when I go to Options / Diff and change Size Limit (Text) from the default 1024KB to something larger than the above file size (ie. 10240KB) then it shows the diff correctly.

The default error message shown for this file is misleading, because it not a binary nor an unchanged file. SourceTree should warn that this file is too large to show a diff using current settings

I'm using SourceTree 2.1.2.5 on Windows 7, with NTFS filesystem.
h3. Solution

Improve the messaging in the UI to inform users as to why the diff is not being displayed (large size in this case).
fields.summary: Improve message displayed when diff fails because file is too large

fields.description: One of our developers got the 2.1.7.0 update, and after updating and restarting he get Authentication failure every time he tries to pull from our Bitbucket Server. We tried to refresh the password for his account but the pull still report authentication failure. Downgrading to 2.1.2.5 and the issue is gone.
fields.summary: Authentication failure after upgrading to 2.1.7.0 & 2.1.8.0

fields.description:
Scenario
 * Use SourceTree
 * Create a feature using the GitFlow button
 * Commit some changes and push to Bitbucket
 * Go to Bitbucket
 * The feature branch shows that it is branched from Master instead of Develop

See attached screenshot.

 

Note that we can close the features correctly from SourceTree.

Does it matter whether Bitbucket shows the feature as being branched from Master?
fields.summary: SourceTree's Feature created via GitFlow shows as being branched from Master in Bitbucket

fields.description:
When running an upgrade from SourceTree 2.1.2.5 to 2.1.7.0 Squirrel.Windows recreates the shortcut used by the Windows Menu.

This process was changed in Squirrel 1.5.0 [{color:#0066cc}[https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows/releases/tag/1.5.0]{color}]

During the upgrade the shortcut is created but there seems to be a problem with the stub executable created.

Running the standalone installer first time or after the upgrade fixes the shortcut.

SourceTree itself is installed correctly.

 

 

*Work Around*
Running the standalone installer, [https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-2.1.7.0.exe,] recreates the shortcut correctly.
fields.summary: Squirrel.Windows 1.7.6 - In App upgrade from ST 2.1.2.5 to ST 2.1.7 fails to create a working shortcut.

fields.description:
If two commits were selected to display a diff between them, refreshing GUI via F5 leads to incorrect commit selection afterwards: 

Initial Situation: You need a repo with a number of commits such that you are able to scroll a selected commit out of view.

 

Try: 
 # At best, while displaying the commit list, scroll down to the end and select any commit.
 # Scroll upwards until the selected commit is out of view, at least one "page up".
 # Hold CTRL and select another commit in your current view. Now you can see the diff between both commits (as intended). (The distance between both commits must be far enough such that SourceTree is not able to show both commits in the list at the same time. You can reduce the window size for that.)
 # Press F5 to refresh GUI and wait until it's done.
 # Now select another commit (without holding down CTRL). Check that SourceTree is still showing the diff between your newly selected commit and the first commit selected at step 1, although clicking on one commit should deselect every other commit.

 This behavior remains until you scroll down to the first commit which was selected at step 1.
fields.summary: GUI refresh corrupts commit selection

fields.description:
The redesigned UI is terrible. It has many severe usability issues.
 # The Folders Metaphor is broken. All Folders always shows everything in all the folders. But if you move something into a custom folder, it is still there in All Folders. And there is no "Unclassified" folder where you can see only the items that have *not* been moved to another folder.
 # The Add folder button always creates a new folder called "New Folder". Then I have to do 3 clicks to get to rename it. And then I have to manually wipe out all the letters of "New Folder". 
 # The spacing on the folders view is too broad. I cannot see half as much stuff as I could before. Vertical space is precious; please don't waste it with extraneous white space.
 # The tabbed metaphor makes it hard to discover the All Folders view. Once I open a project/repo, the All Folders view (I don't know what you call it since I cannot find any reference to it in the menus or buttons) dissappears and I cannot find a way to get it back so that I can open another repo. 

I am tired of complaining so I'll stop here. This is just after trying it for a few minutes. I'm already really pissed off with what you have done to it. Besides, I'm not convinced you care. You have made it so hard to provide any feedback that I'm guessing you are actively discouraging it. It took me about 10 minutes of clicking around, following circular links, before I found somewhere I could send you any info. I didn't really want to open a JIRA ticket for this but you forced me to. And when I clicked on CREATE in the JIRA UI, I got a spinner going round and round and round forever. I had to hack the page URL to get it to come back.
fields.summary: Source 2.1 is ugly and space wasting.
i m being asked to reenter my password every few hours

fields.description:
Hi, i have some issue with button close or maxi, minimize app.
You can see my image here:

!http://i.imgur.com/gyNNieP.gif!


Windows 7 x64
Sourcetree 2.1.2.5
fields.summary: [Windows 7] Issue with Minimize, maximize and close app button!!
Repository Browser: Selected repo not readable with Dark Theme if window not in focus.

fields.description:
I am unable to resize the application from the top of the window.  The left, right, and bottom resize arrows all appear and are usable, however along the top the cursor does not change to a resize arrow and I am unable to resize the screen.

As an additional note, this also means that double clicking the top border to fully expand the screen top to bottom is also not working.
fields.summary: Can't resize window from top

fields.description:
I've created a new repository and now I am trying to clone it in source tree, but above is the error I am getting

 

When I click the details button, this is what I see:

!image-2017-07-19-13-11-01-746.png!

 

I've tried:
 # Removing the bookmark and re-adding it to SourceTree
 # Creating a new repository and cloning it in SourceTree
 # Uninstalling -> restarting PC -> reinstalling

Please help me resolving this issue
fields.summary: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The System cannot find the file specified

fields.description: In previous version you could easily examine changes between two commits by selecting them in the history while pressing CTRL. Now can still select multiple commits, but the diff will only show changes of the last selected commit.
fields.summary: Selecting multiple commits in the history doesn't show the diff.

fields.description:
When creating a release using gitflow and finishing it, then the tag is not merged into the develop branch. It only shows up in the master branch's history. 

Finish release doesn't back-merge to develop.

Also tested both with system and embedded git.
fields.summary: GitFlow - Tags are not merged into develop when finishing release
img-project

fields.description: If ST is maximized and I grab the tile bar to drag to a different monitor, nothing happens. Programs usually "undock" and allow the drag.
fields.summary: When maximized, can't drag to new monitor

fields.description: Click new tab, Click remote, type something in search box and nothing happens, even after enter is pressed.
fields.summary: Add new bookmark from Remote search box doesn't work

fields.description: Every time I click tag details I would like to copy some info from the window but none of that info is selectable. Can you put all of that in one big text box (in tag details window)?
fields.summary: Tag details need to have selectable lables (readonly textboxes)

fields.description: before version 2.1.2.5 any ST version was navigating to a commit when clicked on a tag. Current version 2.1.2.5 does not, so can't easily locate tag, branch of
fields.summary: clicking Tags no longer navigate to commit

fields.description: sourcetree keep showing refresh of tags, remotes, and generally slow. Sometimes won't stop untill restarted or pull clicked. This started to happen with recent updates.
fields.summary: Sourcetree  2.1.2.5 slow
Merge happens many a times while checkout of another branch
git authentication interferring authenticating with bitbucket server

fields.description:
After I updated to version 2.1.2.5, SourceTree crashes on startup.

From the log file:
{quote}ERROR [2016-02-22 10:27:17,138] [53] [SourceTree.ViewModel.DiffViewModel] [AddUnchangedFile] - Error reading file in AddUnchangedFile for C:\Development\hg-to-git\NFU.git\SystemControlGUI\SystemControlGUI\Images\1-0-0-0-0_Toppnivå-1000pix-bredde.jpg
 System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path 'C:\Development\hg-to-git\NFU.git\SystemControlGUI\SystemControlGUI\Images\1-0-0-0-0_Toppnivå-1000pix-bredde.jpg'.
 at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
 at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
 at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access)
 at SourceTree.ViewModel.DiffViewModel.AddUnchangedFile(FileStatusRecord rec, List`1 diffModel) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\ViewModel\DiffViewModel.cs:line 1264
{quote}
 

The letter 'å' seems to be the culprit. The file does exists with that name.

This is not the first time your software struggle with non-english characters, it would be nice if you stopped producing these bugs...
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes at startup when a repo contains files with non english characters

fields.description: When the repo is in a special state, e.g. during a merge conflict or during conflicts of cherry picking, or bisect etc. it would be nice to see the status in Sourcetree and to get the relevent commands of GIT for the next steps. Currently the UI doesn't reflect the status which results in issues with other commands as the user is required by GIT to execute the context specific commands first or abort this state. In case of bisecting e.g.
fields.summary: UX: Repo Status + Context Actions

fields.description:
When selecting "Amend latest commit" while the commit text box is empty, a message box with the following text is displayed:

"Do you want to replace the commit text above with the message form the previous commit?"

Since there is no commit text present, there should not be any message box displayed asking to replace it.
fields.summary: "Amend latest commit" asks to replace empty commit text

fields.description:
Issue first reported here: SRCTREEWIN-3116

The original request was that the user wanted a checkbox implemented for git stash -u and that still hasn't been implemented in the current version. This is a very useful feature, and I agree with him that stashing untracked files is very useful, particularly before switching to another branch.
fields.summary: Add checkbox to include untracked files

fields.description: SourceTree 2.1.2.5 - When switching between already checked out branches, it takes noticeable time waiting until it finishes "Fetching older commits" (which it says it doing). I never seen this issue with the previous version (1.9)
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.1.2.5 | When switching between already checked out branches, it takes noticeable time waiting until it finishes "Fetching older commits" (which it says it doing).

fields.description: After installing SourceTree 2.1.2.5, I am noticing that when you click the mouse on Top Right Controls for Close and Restore, extra icons for Restore or Close show up misplaced to further to the right.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.1.2.5 Top Right Controls for Close and Restore are not behaving correctly

fields.description:
I am having trouble installing SourceTree for All Users in Windows 7.

Behaviors I am seeing
 * It only installs to "~\AppData\Local\SourceTree"

Thanks
fields.summary: Cannot install SourceTree 2.1.2.5 for All Users on Windows 7

fields.description: I am unable to push changes to Bitbucket. Guessing something to do with OS. I am able to check-in using different machine but not on mine. Probably some pre-requisite has to be installed? I am using Sourcetree and bitbucket. Do I have to install anything else? Both the systems OS version is same, Windows 7. Able to successfully clone
fields.summary: Cannot push in latest version of Sourcetree 2.1.2

fields.description: It would be beneficial to see for which changes a pull request has been opened and which are just pushed to a remote branch. In stash it is possible to see the status (before or behind and with or without pull request and status of pull request) for alle branches relativ to the one selected. The feature should deliver a view within source tree that show this for all localy tracked branches.
fields.summary: Add feature to view all pushed changes without pull requests

fields.description:
If a tag is selected under Tags if needed the loading older commit message appears but the commit with the Tag is not focussed.

 

*Steps to reproduce*

1. select any tag from the Tags menu on the left in a repository with tags

*Expected behavior*

commit with the selected tag is focussed

*Actual behavior*

loading information, but commit with tag is not focussed

 

Beta notice:

- fixed in SourceTree beta 2.1.4.0 (SourceTreeSetup-2.1.4-beta-0.exe) and 2.1.5.0
fields.summary: Selecting a tag does not focus the commit
Implement default themes(dark, solarized, material) and custom themes

fields.description:
working with git:

switching branch and hit 'pull' sometimes leads to an unwanted merge, as the 'old' branch is selected.

e.g.

actual branch is "branch1"

now switching branch to "branch2" and hit 'pull' -> active branch is "branch2" but in the pull window there is still "branch1" selected to pull (should be "branch2"). If this isn't noticed by the user, this results of pulling the sources of "branch1" into "branch2", which might result in an unwanted merge of branch1 into branch2. 

Seems to be a timing bug, imho the push and pull options should be disabled while switching a branch. 

This is especially annoying if fast forward is not disabled. 

 

-UPDATE: SEEMS TO BE RESOLVED WITH 2.1.10.0-

UPDATE: Reproduced with 2.3.1.0 on the first try.
fields.summary: Switching branch and hit 'pull' to fast causes a pull of the old branch into the new one

fields.description:
The Branches node in the main window does not show any branches at all. Other views, such as the dialog for creating or deleting branches, do show the branches correctly. And the Remotes node also renders properly, so this issue seems to affect only local branches in the main window.

 

Note that it worked correctly with SourceTree 2.0.20.1
fields.summary: Branches are missing (SourceTree 2.1.2.5 + GVFS)

fields.description:
I would like to request a setting in SourceTree which prompts the user to commit or push his files when he closes the app. The new theme of SourceTree is nice, but with the new tabfunctionality a lot of people (inluding myself) forget to push or commit his/her files at the end of the day.

 

Or is there another way to force this?

 

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Uncommited/pushed files notification

fields.description: It is especially troubling that the window decorations – or lack of them – mean that the window looks the same whether or not it has focus.  This is a huge step backwards from the old, more native look and feel.
fields.summary: Material design is ugly, hard to use

fields.description: When i try to commit something & launch Source Tree it takes more than 1Gb Ram and sometimes more than 80% cpu resources (intel core i5-6600k @ 3,5GHz)
fields.summary: Source Tree takes all cpu resources

fields.description:
When clicking the horizontal scroll bar (to scroll right to see the complete line) the last line is selected automatically, then *stage hunk* become *stage lines*: as you can see at the attached image.

PS: Clicking again the scroll bar deselect the line.
fields.summary: Clicking horizontal scroll bar => automatic line selection

fields.description:
Icons in window are not rendering correctly. Makes them hard to click

!image-2017-07-11-12-40-05-569.png!
fields.summary: Window icons problem: minimize, maximize

fields.description:
I have a repository with only one local branch and several tags along this branch. SourceTree is showing each tagged commit as if it weren't part of the branch.

In the following images I had to remove a lot of information, but I let the first letter of each commit so you can see which commit is which in both images. First in SourceTree:

  !image-2017-07-10-13-02-09-581.png!

Now in gitk (this is the correct one):

  !image-2017-07-10-13-01-13-459.png!
fields.summary: Wrong version tree is displayed

fields.description:
While maximized source tree is resizable on any edge except for the title bar (the top edge and a bit of the left and right edges). Any accidental mis-click+drag changes it to be un-maximized while simultaneously resizing it to be slightly larger than one screen and it spills over to adjacent monitors.

The window also cannot be resized using the title bar's edges while un-maximized. This makes it very difficult to fix the size since only the bottom edge can be used to adjust the height and it's inaccessible because the window now fills the screen.
fields.summary: Window is resizable while maximized

fields.description:
It's very annoying that I cannot drag a maximized source tree window from the top to restore it the way I do with every other window.  I haven't seen this bug since apps were first being made for Windows Vista when Aero Snap was first introduced.  Older versions of MS Office had this problem.

 

Also, the split panels cannot always be resized. For example, the horizontal split between the tree view and staging area is locked with the tree taking up around 70% of the view.  When I try to drag to resize it, it just snaps back to where it was and seems to maintain the ratio no matter how the window is resized.  It makes it  impossible to work with files and diffs efficiently.
fields.summary: Aero Snap doesn't work to drag window when maximized; split panels cannot be resized

fields.description:
I know we can use ctrl-1, ctrl-2 and ctrl-3 to switch between file status, logs and search. I find this very useful as I prefer navigating with the keyboard, rather than the mouse.

It would be awesome to be able to switch between repository tabs (at the top) using the keyboard - perhaps ctrl-pgup and ctrl-pgdown?
fields.summary: Shortcut key to switch between repository tabs

fields.description:
Very slow reactions to user input. Pressing "Pull" button freezes app for 3-4 seconds. Pull window shows up and freeze for next 1-2 seconds for filling up "remote branch to pull" and checking "rebase instead merge" option which is set as default in options. Same thing with fetch, commit, rebase roughly every dialog.

Same commands typed in git console works instantly.
fields.summary: High cpu usage / slow work

fields.description:
I have SourceTree setup to use the OpenSSH client, which prompts me for the password for my SSH key at startup. This works fine for most of the day, howevever sometimes I'll find that push/pull operations no longer work. The progress bar just spins in its indeterminate state forever. This occurs pretty much every day when I get into work in the morning, as if it's losing the SSH agent connection after a period of inactivity. I can fix this by restarting SourceTree but have not found any other solution yet.

I keep SourceTree open on my machine pretty much constantly, my machine is left running all of the time too, only ever rebooting for updates.
fields.summary: SourceTree losing SSH key / configuration after period of time

fields.description: SourceTree downloads the standalone Git and every other zips over HTTP from the Atlassian servers. This is not secure and should be switched to HTTPS.
fields.summary: Git downloads over HTTP

fields.description:
GIT command line has an option "git lfs ls-files" to list the files LFS is tracking.  It would be nice for SourceTree to have a similar option in the GUI but take it a step further.  SourceTree could list the files GIT LFS is tracking and then all the files that fit inside the .gitattributes description of LFS tracking but not being tracked by GIT LFS.  For example, .gitattributes describes to track *.xlsx files where B.xlsx is tracked by GIT LFS.  However, A.xlsx was added before .gitattributes described this tracking.  SourceTree could list A.xlsx & B.xlsx and denote that B is tracked by GIT LFS and A is not.

Another feature that would be nice is the ability to migrate a repo to GIT LFS.  If the repo was clone by SourceTree, initially used with GIT LFS, but then GIT LFS enabled, then it would be nice if SourceTree had the ability to scan all files, comparing to .gitattributes, and migrating the matching files to track with GIT LFS instead of GIT.

Thank you for considering!
fields.summary: GIT LFS 'ls' and 'migrate to lfs'

fields.description:
I do not use ST much, just as a Git visual tool similar (though much inferior) to TortoiseHg for Mercurial. Most of the work I do both with Git and Hg is done via command line in Cygwin environment. I am stating this just to illustrate that I am not an experienced ST user and may be missing something about its settings &c.

However my problem is pretty basic: on the Windows (which I am sort of forced to use in my current job) I have set the Windows panel to be hiding, to not obtrude the view on my IDE and other applications. Unfortunately, when ST is having focus (in maximized mode) it "disables" Windows panel to come up when I put the mouse cursor to the bottom of my screen.

I suppose it has something to do with its new (and rather annoying) non-Windows-standard look-n-feel. (Originality is good as long as it does not get in the way of usability.)
fields.summary: New window style of ST prevents windows panel from going up

fields.description:
h3. Description

Hi, I'm using:
 - SourceTree 2.1.2.5 on 64-bit Windows 10
 - Git 2.13.2
 - P4Merge
 and I have configured P4Merge as the external diff/merge tool.

I have 2 branches:
 - master - commit 09f5e69
 This commit has pushed this picture (pic1).
 - master - commit 09f5e69
 This commit has pushed this picture (pic2).

Since P4Merge can diff pictures, I want to diff those 2 commits with P4Merge. If I click that action, P4Merge returns an error.
h3. Questions

I want to diff 2 commits to compare text codes or pictures.
 Do I have to add "Diff commands" or parameters to diff those 2 commits?
 Or is this feature impossible?

-Best Regards
fields.summary: Diff images using external diff tool with P4Merge

fields.description: If you fetch the sidebar items collapse and you have to re-open them
fields.summary: Sidebar items collapse after fetch

fields.description:
Minimize, maximize and close buttons are messed up in this version. (The normal top right hand windows buttons)

When I open up the app for the first time. I cant click on any of the above mentioned buttons.

They seem to spawn - separate buttons - and i cant click on them - these buttons are unusable. 

i.e. I have to double click to maximize the application.
fields.summary: Sizing window buttons broken

fields.description:
For several different reasons SourceTree can crash and will than send a bugreport via the browser: good.

However, restarting sourcetree after a crash does nothing. Only after rebooting the machine, sourcetree can be started again. This has us baffled, entire team all on win10 reproduced this problem after sourcetree crashed.

Might there be a process or file locked when a crash occurs that is only fixed after the system is rebooted? 

That sourcetree crashes would be more acceptable if it can easily be restarted which is currently not the case. Would it be possible to show a message during startup why starting up fails? ;)
fields.summary: Can't restart sourcetree after a crash

fields.description:
I'm using SourceTree in windows 7 professional.

I have Beyond Compare 4 set up as my diff & merge tool.

It used to work fine until recently.

Now it does not launch.

I checked the global .gitconfig file, and it has bc4 set as the difftool & mergetool.

I can launch the difftool from the git command line,

But not from within SourceTree
fields.summary: External diff does not launch in SourceTree
